model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I attended a really interesting talk today.
 That sounds great. What was the talk about?
It was about the history of the pyramids in Egypt. I learned so much about their construction and the cultural significance they held.
Wow, that does sound interesting. Did you take any notes?
Yes, I took lots of notes. I'm excited to study this topic more on my own time.
That's awesome. It's great to see your enthusiasm for learning.
Thanks. I've always been passionate about learning new things. Remember when we talked about how determined I was to get into college?
Yeah, I remember. You were always studying and taking extra classes.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Studying and Motivation', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A and B discuss studying, motivation, and academic goals.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates A:  Ahh, that feels better. ### Classmates B:  What are you doing?! ### Classmates A:  Just taking off my belt. I hate wearing it all day. ### Classmates B:  I can understand that. But maybe don't throw it across the room next time? ### Classmates A:  Yeah, maybe I shouldn't. So, what's new with you? ### Classmates B: Not much, just trying to finish up this history project. What about you? ### Classmates A: Same here. I'm almost done with my essay on the Industrial Revolution. ### Classmates B: Oh, cool. Have you learned anything interesting? ### Classmates A: Yeah, actually. Did you know that the spinning jenny changed the way textiles were produced and played a big role in the factory system? ### Classmates B:  No, I didn't. That's really interesting. ### Classmates A: Yeah, it's fascinating how innovation can change the course of history. ### Classmates B: Definitely. Speaking of innovation, have you heard about the new technology conference happening next month? I was thinking of attending. ### Classmates A:  No, I haven't. Tell me more about it. ### Classmates A: I really want to get into a good college, so I've been studying hard every day and taking extra classes. ### Classmates B: That's really impressive, how do you manage to stay motivated? ### Classmates A: Honestly, it's not always easy. But thinking about how my hard work will pay off in the end keeps me going. ### Classmates B: I can relate to that. I remember when you threw your belt across the room in frustration a few months ago. Has it gotten any easier for you since then? ### Classmates A: Oh yeah, that was just a moment of frustration. I've learned to channel that energy into my studies and keep pushing forward.' }
```
